comments.body: This is how I feel in the united states right now: https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Cc0RrJxVIAAO9vh.jpg
don't all polls have multiple selections or do you mean being able to add a new selection?

Even though I know HTML CSS and Javascript and I am good at it, hell I even was involved in WebKit development, optimization and bug fixing several years ago, but there are many engines that sit on the DOM and other languages that compile into Javascript, and javascript itself has a lot to know in terms of features that it's impossible for anyone to know or deal with all the scripts and ways that people can build web content.

Okay I see what this is about. I'd like being able to rate and/or order things. I don't think all things are as black and white as a single vote, or maybe even multiple votes can represent. There is a reason why markets and price discovery are better than say voting, its because it allows people to express relative desire of things.

@ekaterina: I can agree with that, and the other problem with rating is there is no sacrifice in it, you're not giving up one thing for another. But ordering/ranking by preference on the other hand does include sacrifice, and people do tend to order by preference in many things. Like if you ask someone to pick up something from the store for you, you might say "get me X, and if they don't have it get me Y". But also if you had a list of uses for something like water for example, that list might be: gardening, drinking, bathing, cleaning clothes, etc, so if you had a limited supply of water you could easily rank the importance of each of those things. You might also say rank presidents by which one you want to win the most to the least.

I think censorship is good in a private sense and bad in the public sense.

I don't think governments should be censoring and if you are granted special permissions by government or given money by the government then they shouldn't censor.

On the other hand if I run a forum about technology and someone tries to flood it with unrelated political nonsense or treats other posters bad, etc, then me deleting your posts is perfectly valid. And if I am unfairly deleting posts, well then start a forum that competes and stake a reputation on being fair.

This is identical to Walter Blocks view on immigration: http://www.watchmybit.com/Video/Show/c74b8597-e9d9-4562-98d2-b0a1bc8beec8

That basically if you don't want 'open' borders and immigrants using welfare then privatize everything, otherwise it is your fault for not privatizing everything.
None of the above because it is all of the above... just as complicated as writing software that has modules written in several different languages, some of which has yet to be discovered!

You don't have to use a moderator to buy off OpenBazaar, you can just directly send Bitcoin but you are of course taking risk trusting the seller will not disappear with your money. They really need to implement something like this 2 of 2 escrow:

http://blackhalo.info/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/whitepaper_twosided.pdf

They said they will do it later, but I feel like they are trying to build up the use of a third parties first, and I feel like given they have investors who haven't fully laid out their plans on how they will get their money back, I will expect all kinds of schemes, some which may make them handicap their software to force people to use third parties for many things.

I was thinking of building a ZeroNet site for testing out that form of escrow to trade testnet coins, you would need to have a bitcoin/litecoin wallet that supports raw transactions through JSONRPC or WebSockets and it looks like libbitcoinjs supports enough ops in custom scripts to do it, the site would probably borrow from ZeroMail to hide transactions between sellers and buyers.
The closest thing I use to 'cloud storage' would be GitHub, otherwise I don't need cloud storage.
